factoid: Pétya said that Natásha was ashamed.
Pétya said that Natásha was in love with Count Bezúkhov.
Pétya said that Natásha was in love with the singer (Natásha’s Italian singing master).
Natásha said that Pétya was stupid.
Pétya said that he was not more stupid than Natásha.
Anna Mikháylovna prepared the countess with hints at dinner.
The countess retired to her own room.
The countess sat in an armchair.
The countess's eyes were fixed on a miniature portrait of her son on the lid of a snuffbox.
The countess cried.
Anna Mikháylovna came on tiptoe to the countess' door.
Anna Mikháylovna told Count Bezúkhov not to come in.
Anna Mikháylovna told Count Bezúkhov to come later.
Anna Mikháylovna went into the room, closing the door behind her.
Count Bezúkhov listened through the keyhole.
Count Bezúkhov heard indifferent voices.
Count Bezúkhov heard Anna Mikháylovna's voice alone.
Count Bezúkhov heard a cry.
Count Bezúkhov heard silence.
Count Bezúkhov heard both voices together with glad intonations.
Count Bezúkhov heard footsteps.
Anna Mikháylovna opened the door.
Anna Mikháylovna wore a proud expression of a surgeon who had just performed a difficult operation.
Anna Mikháylovna told Count Bezúkhov that it was done.
Anna Mikháylovna pointed triumphantly to the countess.
The countess held the snuffbox with its portrait in one hand.
The countess held the letter in the other hand.
The countess pressed the snuffbox and the letter alternately to her lips.
The countess stretched out her arms to Count Bezúkhov.
The countess embraced Count Bezúkhov's bald head.
The countess looked at the letter and the portrait.
The countess pushed away Count Bezúkhov's bald head slightly to press the letter and portrait to her lips again.
Véra entered the room.
Natásha entered the room.
Sónya entered the room.
Pétya entered the room.
The reading of the letter began.
Nicholas gave a brief description of the campaign and the two battles in which he had taken part.
Nicholas mentioned his promotion.
Nicholas kissed his father's hands.
Nicholas kissed his mother's hands.
Nicholas asked for his parents' blessing.
Nicholas kissed Véra.
Nicholas kissed Natásha.
Nicholas kissed Pétya.
Nicholas sent greetings to Monsieur Schelling.
Nicholas sent greetings to Madame Schoss.
Nicholas sent greetings to his old nurse.
Nicholas asked them to kiss for him Sónya.
Nicholas loved Sónya and thought of her just the same as ever.
Sónya heard Nicholas's statement.
Sónya blushed.
Sónya's tears came into her eyes.
Sónya ran away into the dancing hall.
Sónya whirled around the dancing hall at full speed.
Sónya's dress was puffed out like a balloon.
Sónya was flushed and smiling.
Sónya plumped down on the floor.
The countess was crying.
Véra asked the countess why she was crying.
The countess said that from all Nicholas says one should be glad and not cry.
Count Bezúkhov looked at the countess reproachfully.
Natásha looked at the countess reproachfully.
The countess wondered who the count takes after.
